===Physiological Basis and legal implications===
  +
Research is ongoing in to the physiology governing moral decision making. One example, the chemical oxytocin, has been shown to change moral perception and behavior making subjects more trusting and trustworthy. Several legal cases (reference needed) have centered on physiological pathology governing immoral and criminal behavior including a tumor that caused pedophilic behavior and exposure to a pesticide that provoked violent behavior leading to murder.
